name: 7.0.1.6. The Spell's Results
content:
@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.dS0UkKOINqI2iTDX]{(Index) Magic}

@Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.VqmfepmRULVzQGwS]{7.0. Magic Basics}

  • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.QsXwV60ztDqlXSwM]{7.0.1. Casting Spells}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.GiftUNKJHstqRaRu]{7.0.1.1. Choosing a Spell}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.DcA0BhlzGBOmJlBR]{7.0.1.2. Concentration}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.jcWzZxyQlFAl4ovj]{7.0.1.3. Counterspells}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.zsULaA3W562EQNNZ]{7.0.1.4. Caster Level}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.6BXjv5dKzNBoeF6f]{7.0.1.5. Spell Failure}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.uHbJduQkQNwTE2jw]{7.0.1.6. The Spell's Results}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.uoVKBPwOgPq2F1Ie]{7.0.1.7. Special Spell Effects}
    • @Compendium[pf-content.pf-rules.1YlpjJunlELz8Wga]{7.0.1.8. Combining Magic Effects}

Source PRPG Core Rulebook pg. 208

Once you know which creatures (or objects or areas) are affected, and whether those creatures have made successful saving throws (if any were allowed), you can apply whatever results a spell entails.
